title: Citizenship Act protests: From Delhi to Shillong, demonstrators hit the streets
content:
11.28 pm: BJP Working President JP Nadda has asked party MPs to speak to non-Muslim migrants in their constituencies and inform them about the amended law, reports ANI. They are expected to do so between December 14 and December 31.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    11.25 pm: National Democratic Alliance ally Goa Forward Party has joined protests against the amended law in Margao city of Goa, reports News18. It‚Äôs chief Vijai Sardesai says the party stood for communal harmony, inclusivity, and progressiveness, adding ‚Äúdid the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill mean ‚Äúcommunal ammunition bill‚Äù.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    11.20 pm: BJP leader Ashish Shelar writes to Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, asking him to implement the amended Citizenship Act immediately, reports Firstpost. ‚ÄúAs you are aware, the historic Citizenship (Amendment) Bill was passed by both the Houses of the Parliament,‚Äù the letter reads. ‚ÄúIt should be immediately implemented in Maharashtra as well once it comes in effect in the rest of the country after the President gives assent to it.‚ÄùPresident Ram Nath Kovind has given his assent to the amended law earlier late on Thursday.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    11.18 pm: A case has been filed against Dravida Munetra Kazhagam Youth Wing Secretary Udhayanidhi Stalin for protesting against the amended law and for tearing off a copy of the Citizenship Act earlier on Friday, reports ANI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    11.17 pm: Deputy Commissioner of Police South East Delhi Chinmoy Biswal says the situation in Jamia Milia Islamia University is under control. ‚ÄúThe protesters pelted stones at police which has left 12 police personnel injured, two among them are in ICU,‚Äù he says.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Chinmoy Biswal, DCP South East,Delhi: Situation in Jamia Milia Islamia University (where a protest took place against #CitizenshipAmendmentAct today) is under control now. The protesters pelted stones at police which has left 12 police personnel injured,two among them are in ICU. pic.twitter.com/iSsEyaJBlW‚Äî ANI (@ANI) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    11.13 pm: Chief Public Relations Officer of Northeast Frontier Railway says special passenger trains are being run to help passengers who are stranded at Guwahati so that they can reach Upper Assam. ‚ÄúOne train was was operated yesterday to Dimapur and one each to Furkating and Dibrugarh today [Friday],‚Äù the official tells ANI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    10.26 pm: Call for a protest in Mumbai on December 19:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    everyone!! protest against the CAB in Mumbai, please show up ‚úäüèΩ pic.twitter.com/fM7ssc8BJY‚Äî rituja (@Chamelea17) December 12, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    10.23 pm: Visuals from a protest march in Mumbai. Protestors say the police dragged them during a peaceful agitation.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #SaveUsFromthePolice #SaveIndia Ppl being dragged by cops during a peaceful March at Marine Drive , Mumbai in solidarity with Assam against CAB pic.twitter.com/U65GWIJYTE‚Äî Rupspp (@rupspp) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    9.10 pm: Leader of Opposition in the Assam Legislative Assembly Debabrata Saikia, Congress MP Abdul Khaleque, and the party‚Äôs MLA Rupjyoti Kurmi moved the Supreme Court against the Citizenship Amendment Act. The plea will be mentioned for urgent listing on Monday. Advocates Syed Burhanur Rahman and Pyoli will represent them.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.54 pm: Eight columns of the Indian Army and Assam Rifles have been deployed in Assam to tackle the ongoing protests, reports PTI. Defence Public Relation Officer Lt Col P Khongsai said the security personnel are deployed in Morigaon, Sonitpur and Dibrugarh districts apart from Guwahati.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.49 pm: Congress minister Nitin Raut says his party will not allow the implementation of the amended law in the state. ‚ÄúThe Congress is opposed to the amended act and we will not let it be implemented in Maharashtra,‚Äù he tells PTI. ‚ÄúI think Uddhavji [Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray] will completely cooperate with us.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.46 pm: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankar criticises Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for refusing to implement the amended citizenship law in the state. ‚ÄúIt is no longer a bill, but a law,‚Äù he says, according to PTI. ‚ÄúThe Parliament had cleared the bill, following which the President gave his assent. So a chief minister, who is holding a constitutional post and has taken oath of the Indian Constitution, can‚Äôt just say that she will not implement the law.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.44 pm: Earlier in the day, Janata Dal (United) leader Gulam Rasool has taken part in a protest rally in Patna, Bihar against the amended citizenship law, report PTI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Bihar: Janata Dal United's, member of state legislative council Gulam Rasool Balyawi (in green kurta), took part in a protest march in Patna against #CitizenshipAmendmentAct and #NRC, earlier today. pic.twitter.com/gQSvxPDVJH‚Äî ANI (@ANI) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.39 pm: United Nations Human Rights has raised concerns against the amendments to the Citizenship Act. The world body has described the legislation as ‚Äúdiscriminatory in nature‚Äù. ‚ÄúWhile the goal of protecting persecuted groups is welcome, this should be done through a robust national asylum system that is premised on the principle of equality and non-discrimination, and which applies to all people in need of protection from persecution and other human rights violations, with no distinction as to race, religion, national origin or other prohibited grounds,‚Äù the statement read.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #India: We are concerned that the new #CitizenshipAmendmentAct is fundamentally discriminatory in nature. Goal of protecting persecuted groups is welcomed, but new law does not extend protection to Muslims, incl. minority sects: https://t.co/ziCNTWvxc2#FightRacism #CABProtests pic.twitter.com/apWbEqpDOZ‚Äî UN Human Rights (@UNHumanRights) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.25 pm: Assam Director General of Police Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta tells NDTV that the situation in the state is under control. ‚ÄúWe are on our way to peace,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúToday is a much better day, but we will keep a tight vigil. We have our duties in place, and our teams are working tirelessly.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.11 pm: The alumni of Jamia Millia Islamia University has issued a statement on the police action against protesting students, reports India Today. They call for the immediate release of detained students, action and inquiry against the police brutality, and ask authorities to rescind the amendments to the citizenship law.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.55 pm: The Northeast Frontier Railway says at least 106 passenger trains stand cancelled or short-terminated due to protests, reports PTI. Trains including Guwahati-Jorhat Janshatabdi Express, up and down Tinsukia-Naharlagun Intercity Express, Rajendranagar-New Tinsukia Express, Sealdah-Silchar Kanchanjungha Express are cancelled for Saturday.The Rajdhani Express that left New Delhi on Thursday has also been short terminated.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.52 pm: Commander-in- Chief of United Liberation Front of Asom (Independent) chief Paresh Baruah cautions authorities against use of force on protestors, reports PTI. ‚ÄúStudents, Krishak Mukti Sangram Samiti, and all sections of the society have come out in large numbers to protest peacefully but force was used by the authorities in an attempt to repress them,‚Äù Baruah says. ‚ÄúIf this continues, we will not tolerate it and give a befitting reply.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.37 pm: Maldives‚Äô Parliament Speaker Mohamed Nasheed says the amended law is India‚Äôs internal matter, reports PTI. ‚ÄúI have complete trust in Indian democracy and whatever comes out from the process would be what majority of people from India want,‚Äù Nasheed says. ‚ÄúIndia is one of the safe haven for persecuted minority communities.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.33 pm: Visuals from a protest against the amendments to the law in Margao, Goa:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    And it's spreading. #CABBill2019 pic.twitter.com/wNAE3Wp4hG‚Äî Hasiba üåà (@HasibaAmin) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.27 pm: The parliamentary committee on Home Affairs has postponed its field trip to Assam from December 18 to December 21 in view of the protests, reports PTI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.21 pm: Bharatiya Janata Party General Secretary Ram Madhav claims to be the first to secure an Inner Line Permit to enter Manipur on Friday.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Seems I happened to be the First person to secure Inner Line Permit before entering Manipur today. https://t.co/m0EBAKsouo pic.twitter.com/Hhmkh4bfCB‚Äî Ram Madhav (@rammadhavbjp) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.17 pm: The All Arunachal Pradesh Students‚Äô Union has asked the Centre and the state government to clarify their stand on the Chakma-Hajong refugees. ‚ÄúWe want a clear-cut answer from New Delhi whether the Chakma-Hajongs will remain as refugees or as citizens,‚Äù the group‚Äôs chief Hawa Bagang tells PTI. ‚ÄúIf they [refugees] are given the citizenship status where will they be settled?‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.11 pm: Earlier in the day, students and teachers of Aligarh Muslim University protested against the amendments to the citizenship law. They have handed over two memorandums to authorities, calling for the immediate withdrawal of the amendments to the Citizenship Act.Also read:Citizenship Act protests: FIR against AMU students for defying prohibitory orders 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.07 pm: Arunachal chief minister asks Chief Secretary Naresh Kumar and Director General of Police RP Upadhyaya to direct police personnel to conduct patrols, and ensure residents of the state are safe, reports PTI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.05 pm: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu asks state officials to ensure strict checking of Inner Line Permits in check points set up across the state. The permit is a document that outsiders need before travelling to places defined as ‚Äúprotected areas‚Äù in some states in the North East. The Inner Line Permit system covers the whole of Arunachal Pradesh, Mizoram, most of Nagaland, Meghalaya and Tripura, Manipur and certain pockets of Assam.Also read:Nagaland extends Inner Line Permit system to whole of Dimapur district  
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.59 pm: List of trains that are cancelled:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    pic.twitter.com/4hbdSLKDWs‚Äî N. F. Railway (@RailNf) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.51 pm: Visuals from earlier on Friday of security forces on the streets of Guwahati, Assam:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Assam: Earlier visuals of security deployed in Guwahati. pic.twitter.com/ny3dnVgH6D‚Äî ANI (@ANI) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.50 pm: Opposition Leader in Kerala and Congress‚Äô Ramesh Chennithala says the party has requested Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan for a joint protest against the law. ‚Äú[The ] chief minister has agreed, all ministers and leaders of the Assembly and Opposition also will sit together at Martyrs Column on December 16 [Monday] to raise our voice,‚Äù he tells ANI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.42 pm: Congress leader P Chidambaram says the amended law will be vulnerable in court and describes it as unconstitutional. ‚ÄúWhen this government fails, they [the leaders] come out with past context,‚Äù he tells India Today. ‚ÄúTheir focus is to fulfill their Hindu Rashtra agenda. The net result of CAB [Citizenship Amendment Bill] and NRC [National Register of Citizens] will be to exclude Muslims.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.35 pm: At least 50 protestors at Jamia Milia Islamia were detained, and the police has banned large gatherings in the area, PTI reports. ‚ÄúWe had placed barricades which they [students] broke and tried to jump over them,‚Äù an unidentified senior police official says. ‚ÄúThen they threw stones at us forcing us to use teargas shells. The students have been detained and taken to Badarpur police station.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.32 pm: Six trains stand cancelled and two partially cancelled due to the protests in the North East, reports ANI, quoting Deepak Kumar, the chief public relations officer of Northern Railway.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Deepak Kumar, Chief Public Relations Officer (CPRO), Northern Railway: Due to agitation in Assam and North East (NF Railway) six trains have been cancelled and two trains have been partially cancelled.‚Äî ANI (@ANI) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.29 pm: Earlier in the day, students unions in Arunachal Pradesh boycotted exams to protest against the amended citizenship law. A large group of demonstrators, led by Rajiv Gandhi University Students‚Äô Union and Students‚Äô Union of North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology marched to Raj Bhavan, reports PTI. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.22 pm: The Naga Students‚Äô Federation has called a six-hour bandh in protest against the amended citizenship law on Saturday, reports Firstpost. The agitation will begin at 6 am and will go on till 12 pm. ‚Äú...to express the resentment of the Naga people against the passing of the contentious Citizenship Amendment Bill (CAB) in the Parliament, much against the interests and sentiments of the indigenous people in the North East states,‚Äù reads the statement.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.17 pm: Train services in Sealdah division of the Eastern Railway was disrupted due to protests against the amendments to the Citizenship Act, unidentified officials tell PTI. Trains between Sealdah and Krishnanagar areas are still running.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.09 pm: Visuals from a protest rally in Shillong.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Shillong. Massive rally now against Citizenship Act. #CABProtests pic.twitter.com/SBvFSnE1kn‚Äî Tongam Rina (@tongamrina) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.05 pm: Assam Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal says he will not tolerate any violence, and adds that strong action will be taken against protestors involved in vandalism, reports PTI. ‚ÄúI am committed to protect the rights of the indigenous people of Assam,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúCongress, communal forces behind Assam violence. No one who is involved in violence will be spared.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.50 pm: Visuals from Friday‚Äôs protest rally against the amendments to the Citizenship Act in Shillong. Twenty people are reportedly injured in the agitation.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Today‚Äôs rally (just one part of Shillong rallies) at #CABProtest #NortheastIsBurning #Shillong. No national news cover this @RahulGandhi @ndtv pic.twitter.com/5ayK0ZdGSY‚Äî Manuni (@ManuniTlau) December 13, 2019



    Twenty people injured today at Shillong #CABProtests #NortheastIsBurning #Shillong ... https://t.co/VvEqTAxONp via @YouTube‚Äî Manuni (@ManuniTlau) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.46 pm: Maharashtra Home Minister Eknath Shinde speaks on the amendments to the Citizenship Act, says people of all caste, religion and language live in Maharashtra. ‚ÄúAll of them should feel that this government is theirs,‚Äù he tells ANI. ‚ÄúOur government will continue to maintain a free atmosphere and see that law and order is maintained.‚ÄùHe adds that there is no pressure on the Shiv Sena on the matter and that the party‚Äôs chief Uddhav Thackeray will take a decision in the state‚Äôs interest.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.39 pm: The Beldanga railway station in West Bengal‚Äôs Murshidabad district was set ablaze, PTI reports, citing unidentified Railway Protection Force officials. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.32 pm: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation says entry and exit for all metro stations are now open. Normal services has been resumed.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Security UpdateEntry & exit gates at all stations have been opened. Normal services have resumed in all stations.‚Äî Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (@OfficialDMRC) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.28 pm: Officials say efforts are being made to help passengers stuck at airports, railway stations, and inter-state bus terminals, reports PTI. Kamrup (Metro) district spokesperson says buses are being arranged to transport stranded commuters at the Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport, bus and railway stations.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.24 pm: Some more visuals from the agitation against amendments to the Citizenship Act outside Jamia Milia Islamia University:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Visuals from Jamia Millia Islamia's protests against #CitizenshipAmmendmentBill2019.There was lathicharge and stones pelted. pic.twitter.com/rMs1PkikNp‚Äî ùòºùôñùô¶ùôûùôó ùôçùôñùôØùôñ ùôÜùôùùôñùô£ (@aaqibrk) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.23 pm: Visuals outside Jamia Milia Islamia in Delhi where police are clashing with protestors:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Outside Jamia, running battles between students and police. Constant shelling for the last 10-15 mins.#CABProtests #delhi #jamia pic.twitter.com/DvGCRiJt7D‚Äî Devjyot Ghoshal (@DevjyotGhoshal) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.03 pm: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has closed entry and exit gates at Patel Chowk and Janpath stations due to protests. Trains will not stop at these two stations.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Security UpdateAs advised by Delhi Police, entry & exit at Patel Chowk and Janpath have been closed. Trains will not be halting at these stations.‚Äî Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (@OfficialDMRC) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.02 pm: More visuals from Jamia Milia Islamia University:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Can't wait for the Delhi police statement denying this. #CABProtest at Jamia Milliia Islamia. #CABPassed pic.twitter.com/zhfJduI0ck‚Äî atul krishna (@atulkrishna) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.55 pm: Visuals from Delhi‚Äôs Jamia Millia Islamia University where a protest has broken out:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    This is happening in Delhi right now. Video by my colleague @journoshivs pic.twitter.com/vuSn4EVI1Q‚Äî Rahul Sabharwal (@rubberneckin) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.53 pm: At least 11 petitions filed in the Supreme Court against the Citizenship Amendment Act so far. The  pleas were filed by:
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Indian Union Muslim League.Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra.Peace Party.Former Union minister and Congress leader Jairam Ramesh.NGOs Rihai Manch and Citizens Against Hate.Ehtesham Hashmi, a Supreme Court lawyer.Kirit Pradyot Deb Barman, the head of the Tripura royal family.Jan Adhikaar Party General secretary Faizuddin¬†Former Ambassador to Bangladesh Deb Mukherjee and others.Advocate ML Sharma.A group of students from Symbiosis Law School.

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.41 pm: Union Home Minister Amit Shah cancels trip to Shillong to visit the North East Police Academy, reports ANI. He is scheduled to be in Jharkhand on Saturday and Monday.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.38 pm: The Meghalaya state government has issued helpline numbers for those stranded in Shillong.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Helpline numbers for people stranded in #Shillong. @SangmaConrad Govt taking measures to bring normalcy #CABProtest pic.twitter.com/IEFvxj7WHw‚Äî Karma Paljor (@Karma_Paljor) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.35 pm: Protests against the amendments to the Citizenship Act in Delhi‚Äôs Jamia Millia Islamia University turns violent. Police reportedly use tear gas, lathicharge demonstrators.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Teargas used, stones being thrown by police and students, many injured. Bus and car smashed. Violence continues. pic.twitter.com/CizBWXvpOb‚Äî Kainat Sarfaraz. (@kainisms) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.30 pm: ‚ÄúModi had promised to deport all illegal immigrants after May 16, 2014,‚Äù Bhattacharya says. ‚ÄúHe did not send back a single illegal Bangladeshi, instead he is now welcoming them.‚Äù He adds that the Assam Accord is a ‚Äúnational commitment‚Äù that was discussed in the Parliament before getting constitutional validity, PTI reports.In 1985, Assamese nationalists had signed the Assam Accord with the Centre to end a six-year long anti-foreigner agitation. According to the Accord, only those Bangladeshi migrants who came to Assam before 1971 would be eligible for Indian citizenship.  
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.28 pm: The Supreme Court has registered a petition filed by the All Assam Students Union challenging the amendments to the Citizenship Act. The group‚Äôs Chief Adviser Samujjal Bhattacharya attacked the BJP for ‚Äúbetraying‚Äù the people of Assam, reports PTI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.23 pm: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Kamal Nath accuses the Centre of practicing ‚Äúpolitics of distractions‚Äù, reports PTI. ‚ÄúEvery time there is an economic slowdown, a bill is introduced, a decision is taken to distract people,‚Äù he says.On the question of whether his state would follow West Bengal, Punjab, and Kerala‚Äôs decision to not implement the amendments to the Citizenship Act, Nath says the Congress‚Äô stand on any law that divides the society will also be the stance of the Madhya Pradesh government.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.16 pm: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announces mega rally in Kolkata against amendments made to the Citizenship Act.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #BREAKING @MamataOfficial announces mega rally against #CitizenshipAmendmentBill2019 on December 16 in #Kolkata. The rally will begin near the statue of Dr BR Ambedkar and end at Jorasanko. Didi will walk in the rally‚Äî All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.53 pm: Police resort to lathicharge, use tear gas shells after protestors allegedly start pelting stones in front of Raj Bhavan in Shillong, reports EastMojo. Thousands of protestors are at the site.The crowd marched from Motphran to Raj Bhavan and held a short public meeting there. Slogans were shouted against the governor, who has not yet signed the ordinance to amend the Meghalaya Residents Safety and Security Act, 2016. The ordinance makes it mandatory for visitors spending more than 24 hours in the state to register themselves on entry.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.52 pm: Vehicles queue up amid fuel scarcity in Itanagar Capital Complex.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #ArunachalPradesh : Fuel scarcity in Capital Complex, Itanagar. Vehicles queuing up to 2 km. pic.twitter.com/xRh9wZU5Po‚Äî EastMojo (@EastMojo) December 13, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.35 pm: Actor-turned-politician Jatin Bora on Thursday resigned from the Bharatiya Janata Party to protest against the amendments made to the Citizenship Act. He has also quit as the chairperson of the state-run Assam State Film Finance Development Corporation.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.28 pm: Students of Jamia Millia Islamia University stage a protest in Delhi.
